requirements: Enrollment limited to first-year students with a score of 4 or 5 on the Advanced Placement examination in Biology or the equivalent. Preregistration required; see under First-Year Seminar Program.
description:
Analysis of issues in public health and medicine that get extensive media attention and provoke policy debates.Â Topics include vaccination, the value of cancer screening and genetic testing, determinants of a healthy lifestyle, the U.S. role in global health, and the cost of health care. Students critique and produce medical journalism.
Enrollment limited to first-year students with a score of 4 or 5 on the Advanced Placement examination in Biology or the equivalent. Preregistration required; see under First-Year Seminar Program.
